fine_dining.name: Selene Restaurant
signature_dishes: Creative interpretations of Santorinian classics (Fava, Tomatokeftedes)
Fine dining tasting menus featuring local ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant and refined, often with caldera views (location may vary), focusing on high gastronomy
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book far in advance, especially for caldera view tables. Ideal for a very special occasion. Check current location (moved from Pyrgos).
fine_dining.local_tips: A pioneering restaurant in elevating Santorinian cuisine. Offers cooking classes and wine tastings. Expect innovative dishes and exceptional service.

fine_dining.name: Lauda Restaurant (Andronis Boutique Hotel)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Luxurious, romantic setting carved into the cliffside in Oia with breathtaking caldera views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Essential to book well ahead for sunset. Specify table preference for views. Located within a luxury hotel.
fine_dining.local_tips: Historically the first restaurant in Oia (est. 1971). Offers an unforgettable fine dining experience with one of the best views on the island.

fine_dining.name: Ambrosia Restaurant
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, candlelit terraces overlooking the Oia caldera, very romantic ambiance
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book early and request a front-row caldera view table. Limited seating.
fine_dining.local_tips: Known for its incredibly romantic setting and classic fine dining dishes. Perfect for couples.

casual_dining.name: Metaxy Mas
signature_dishes: Creative daily specials based on seasonal ingredients
casual_dining.atmosphere: Hidden gem with a charming courtyard and terrace offering panoramic island views (not caldera), rustic and authentic feel
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Highly recommended, often booked out weeks in advance
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book well ahead, especially for dinner. Located outside main tourist hubs, near Exo Gonia/Pyrgos.
casual_dining.local_tips: A favorite among locals and informed tourists for its excellent, authentic food and beautiful setting away from the crowds. Worth the detour.

casual_dining.name: Ammoudi Fish Tavern(s)
signature_dishes: Freshly caught fish grilled or fried (choose from display)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Iconic setting right on the water's edge in Ammoudi Bay below Oia, casual yet vibrant
casual_dining.reservation_needed: Highly recommended, especially for sunset tables at popular spots like Dimitris or Katina
casual_dining.booking_tips: Choose your fish from the day's catch. Be prepared for the steps down/up from Oia or take a taxi. Book specific taverna (e.g., Dimitris Ammoudi Taverna, Sunset Ammoudi by Paraskevas, Taverna Katina).
casual_dining.local_tips: Classic Santorini experience. Very fresh seafood in a picturesque location. Prices can be high, especially for premium fish.

casual_dining.name: To Psaraki
signature_dishes: Fresh fish prepared with modern techniques
casual_dining.atmosphere: Relaxed waterfront taverna overlooking Vlychada marina and unique volcanic cliffs
casual_dining.booking_tips: Located away from main towns, near Vlychada beach and marina. Good stop after exploring the south coast.
casual_dining.local_tips: Known for its fresh ingredients, refined yet simple seafood dishes, and pleasant atmosphere away from the caldera crowds.

casual_dining.name: Candouni (Kantouni)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy, traditional taverna tucked away in a quiet alley in Oia, with a beautiful garden courtyard
casual_dining.booking_tips: Offers a more intimate and traditional dining experience in often-crowded Oia.
casual_dining.local_tips: A long-standing Oia favorite for its authentic food and romantic, slightly hidden location.

street_food.name: Lucky's Souvlaki
street_food.local_tips: Iconic, no-frills souvlaki joint in Fira, famous for its delicious and affordable gyros. Often a queue, moves fast.

street_food.name: Yogi Gyro
street_food.local_tips: Popular spot for a quick, tasty, and budget-friendly meal in the Imerovigli area.

street_food.name: Pitogyros
street_food.local_tips: Well-regarded option for quality souvlaki and gyros in Oia, often busy.

coffee_shops.name: Passaggio
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Modern cafe in Oia with stunning caldera views from its terrace
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great spot for a quality coffee break while enjoying the famous Oia view. Can get busy.

coffee_shops.name: Galini Cafe
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Charming, multi-level cafe in Firostefani offering spectacular caldera views in a relaxed setting
coffee_shops.food_options: Breakfast, brunch, salads, sandwiches, crepes, cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: Located along the Fira-Oia path in Firostefani. Perfect stop for refreshments with an amazing view, often less crowded than Fira/Oia main spots.

coffee_shops.name: Coffee Island / Grigoris (Chains)
coffee_shops.local_tips: Ubiquitous Greek coffee chains found in Fira and other villages. Good for a quick, consistent, and affordable coffee fix, especially takeaway Freddos.

bars.name: Franco's Bar
bars.atmosphere: Iconic, sophisticated bar in Fira famous for its caldera views, deck chairs, and classical music soundtrack
bars.reservation_needed: Highly recommended for sunset deck chairs
bars.local_tips: A Santorini institution since 1979. Known for its unique atmosphere combining stunning views with classical music. Dress smartly. Drinks are expensive.

bars.name: PK Cocktail Bar (Palia Kameni)
bars.specialty: Panoramic Caldera Views & Extensive Cocktail List
signature_drinks: Wide range of classic and signature cocktails
bars.atmosphere: Stylish bar spread over several terraces in Fira, offering arguably some of the best panoramic sunset views
bars.reservation_needed: Essential for good sunset tables, book ahead
bars.local_tips: Arrive early even with a reservation to secure the best spot. Offers unparalleled views of the caldera and sunset.

bars.name: Santo Wines Winery Terrace
bars.specialty: Santorinian Wine Tasting with Caldera Views
bars.atmosphere: Large, modern winery terrace perched on the caldera edge near Pyrgos, spectacular views, often busy
bars.food_options: Cheese/Meat platters, light snacks pairing with wine
bars.reservation_needed: Highly recommended for sunset tasting slots
bars.local_tips: Very popular spot combining wine tasting with amazing views. Book tasting packages online. Can feel touristy but the view and wine are worth it.

bars.name: Marykay's Bar / Hassapiko
bars.type: Music Bar / Old Butcher Shop Bar
bars.atmosphere: Funky, alternative bar in Oia (Marykay's/Hassapiko) housed in an old butcher shop, often with live rock/jazz music
bars.local_tips: A legendary Oia spot for those seeking something different from the caldera view bars. Known for its character and good music. Check for live music schedule.

food_tours.name: Santorini Wine & Food Tasting Tour
highlights: Visiting 1-2 local wineries for tasting (Assyrtiko, Vinsanto)
Sampling local products like fava, tomatokeftedes, chloro cheese, capers
Learning about Santorini's unique volcanic terroir and agriculture
food_tours.booking_tips: Combines winery visits with local food tasting. Several operators offer variations. Check inclusions (transport, number of wineries, food provided).

cooking_classes.name: Santorinian Cuisine Cooking Class
what_you_learn: Preparing Santorini specialties like Tomatokeftedes (tomato fritters), Fava, Santorinian Salad
Using unique local ingredients (cherry tomatoes, white eggplant, capers)
includes: Hands-on instruction, ingredients, recipes, lunch/dinner with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Offered by restaurants (like Selene), wineries, or dedicated cooking schools. Look for classes emphasizing local products.

markets.name: Local Mini Markets & Grocery Stores
highlights: Finding local products like Santorini cherry tomatoes (fresh or paste), capers, fava beans, chloro cheese (if lucky)
markets.hours: Varies, generally long hours in tourist season
markets.location: Villages throughout the island (Fira, Oia, Pyrgos, Kamari etc.)
markets.local_tips: Santorini doesn't have large central markets like Crete. Smaller shops in villages are the main places to find local produce and products. Selection varies.

markets.name: Winery Shops
highlights: Extensive selection of the winery's own wines (Assyrtiko, Nykteri, Vinsanto)
Often sell local products like capers, tomato paste, sweets
markets.hours: Typically winery opening hours (check specific winery)
markets.location: Various wineries across the island (Santo Wines, Venetsanos, Estate Argyros, Domaine Sigalas etc.)
markets.local_tips: Best place to buy specific wines after tasting. Can often arrange shipping.

key_local_products: Santorini Cherry Tomatoes (Tomataki Santorinis): Intensely flavored, small tomatoes grown with minimal water.
Fava Santorinis: Creamy yellow split pea puree, a PDO product, often served warm with olive oil, onions, capers.
White Eggplant (Melitzana Lefki): Sweet, seedless white eggplant, often fried or made into a salad.
Katsouni: A type of local cucumber with a thicker skin and unique flavor.
Capers & Caper Leaves: Grow wild, used widely in salads and dishes.
Chlorotyri: Fresh, creamy goat cheese, hard to find, sometimes made at home.
Assyrtiko Wine: Santorini's flagship white grape, producing dry white wines with high acidity and minerality.
Vinsanto: Traditional sweet dessert wine made from sun-dried grapes (Assyrtiko, Aidani), aged for years.
dishes_to_try: Tomatokeftedes: Santorini tomato fritters, often with herbs and onion.
Sfougato: Savory crustless pie/omelette, often with zucchini or cheese.
Apochti: Air-dried salted pork loin, similar to prosciutto.
Brandada: Salt cod puree (influence from historical trade).
Rabbit or Lamb cooked in wine sauce.
Melitinia: Sweet cheese pies, typically made for Easter.
